name: Sannihith Banala
role: Data Analyst · Power BI · SQL · Python

about.title: Data Analyst
about.contactIntro: Open to new analytics roles and collaborations. Let's talk data.
paragraphs: I'm drawn to the moment when a messy spreadsheet becomes a clear answer. After 2+ years working across consulting and enterprise analytics — at BDO Global and Wipro — I've built dashboards that replaced Monday morning emails and SQL pipelines that made the data team's backlog disappear.

Whether it's migrating 12+ legacy Crystal reports to Power BI, cutting report load times by 40% with star-schema SQL views, or supporting 50+ business users on a US telecom account, the common thread is always the same: make the data work for the people who need to act on it, not the other way around.

Outside client work, I'm building a market-data pipeline in Python — pulling live sector ETF data, running KMeans clustering to find behavioural patterns that standard sector labels miss, and using a Markov transition matrix to make the output actually investable. It's the kind of project that keeps the tools sharp.

projects.title: Sector Rotation Analytics Pipeline
projects.description: Automated ML pipeline analysing S&P 500 sector behaviour under different macro conditions. Pulls live OHLCV data for 11 sector ETFs plus 3 macro indicators (10Y yield, VIX, Dollar Index), engineers return/volatility/momentum/Sharpe features, applies KMeans clustering with Silhouette validation on rolling monthly windows, and builds a Markov regime-transition matrix — delivered as a 4-page Power BI dashboard with drill-through capability.

bullets: Took 12+ client reports stuck in legacy Crystal/Jasper formats and rebuilt them as interactive Power BI dashboards — what used to take 3 days now lands in stakeholders' inboxes the same morning.

Designed a consolidated 3-page dashboard for a mid-market retailer bringing together HR headcount, finance P&L, and operations throughput in one view — the team reclaimed ~6 hours of manual Excel work every week.
Rebuilt the underlying data layer using star-schema views with incremental refresh, which cut dashboard load times by roughly 40% without touching the front-end.
Wrote DAX time-intelligence measures (YTD, QTD, rolling averages) so leadership could spot trends on their own instead of waiting for month-end reports.
Set up three Power Automate flows for weekly report distribution — eliminated the recurring email threads asking 'did you send the numbers?'
Presented dashboard walkthroughs regularly to business leads with no data background, which taught me that the best visual doesn't need an explanation.
Owned development and maintenance of 8 dashboards serving 50+ business users across a US telecom client's sales, ops, and network divisions.

Rewrote core SQL queries using CTEs and window functions to replace deeply nested subqueries — the logic became clean enough that the onshore team could maintain it without digging through documentation.
Built Python ETL scripts (pandas, NumPy) to pre-aggregate large transactional datasets upstream so dashboards wouldn't time out during peak hours.
Reduced dashboard query runtime by ~30% through SQL optimisation and materialised views — significantly cut down on 'it's running slow today' complaints.
Delivered weekly KPI digests to senior management via automated email pipelines, replacing a manual copy-paste process that nobody liked doing.
Sat between the client's onshore team and the offshore build team, turning vague business questions into specific metric definitions both sides could agree on.

education.degree: Ontario College Graduate Certificate — Big Data Analytics
Bachelor of Technology — Computer Science & Engineering
